go_data.justification: CDC45 is part of the CMG complex that catalyses the unwinding of the DNA, allowing origin firing and the establishment of active replication forks.
CDC45 associates with the MCM2/7 helicase and the GINS complex to form the active CMG complex, which catalyses the unwinding of the DNA.
CDC45 is involved in DNA replication, which occurs in the nucleus.
